Disease.content:
Please identify the "Disease" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Disease". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: To investigate how GAP43 expression ( GAP43 - ir ) correlates with MFS , we assessed the intensity ( densitometry ) and extension ( width ) of GAP43 - ir in the inner molecular layer of the dentate gyrus ( IML ) of rats subject to status epilepticus induced by pilocarpine ( Pilo ) , previously injected or not with cycloheximide ( CHX ) , which has been shown to inhibit MFS .

Let's think step by step.

| Disease |
| --- |
| Status epilepticus (induced by pilocarpine) |
| MFS (Molecular Filamentous Surge) |

In this paragraph, "status epilepticus" and "MFS (Molecular Filamentous Surge)" are the identified diseases. The former refers to a seizure state that lasts for a prolonged period, while the latter is a specific neurological condition, likely related to neuronal excitability and filamentous structures.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Disease" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Disease".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Disease |
| --- |
| Status epilepticus (induced by pilocarpine) |
| MFS (Molecular Filamentous Surge) |

In the revised table, only "status epilepticus" and "MFS (Molecular Filamentous Surge)" remain as the identified diseases. The other entities, such as "GAP43 expression," "GAP43 - ir," "inner molecular layer of the dentate gyrus (IML)," "rats," "pilocarpine," and "cycloheximide," do not clearly refer to diseases.
